meanings.definition: To fix or repair something again.
meanings.sent1: I had to refix the broken chair after it fell apart.
meanings.sent2: She is refixing the leaky faucet in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The handyman kept refixing the same shelf, but it just wouldn't stay up.
meanings.sent4: He felt like he was refixing his life after a series of setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was refixing the engine with precision and care.

meanings.definition: To attach a prefix to a word or phrase again.
meanings.sent1: After realizing the mistake, she had to refix the prefix to the word.
meanings.sent2: He is refixing the prefix 'un-' to the word 'happy'.
meanings.sent3: The teacher accidentally refixed the wrong prefix to the word, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was refixing the foundation of language with each new prefix.
meanings.sent5: The linguist was refixing the prefixes with expertise and attention to detail.
